comment: She is very hard to understand and gets upset when not understood.  She rarely responds or acknowledges emails sent to her.  There is lots of downtime, most of the class time is wasted by her walking around checking each persons project.  Struggled to navigate Word and Powerpoint (which the class was based on) and often seemed unprepared for class.

AVOID THIS PROFESSOR, doesn't teach whatsoever, gives unclear directions, and does not give enough time for tests or quizzes. You will have to teach yourself everything. The final for this class is 60 multiple choice, 20 short answer, with only 75 minutes total. If you want to actually be taught the material you need, avoid this class.

You are expected to get all your information from this class just from the textbook. There are powerpoints, but they do not go in depth enough to help you learn. The powerpoints seem like they are set up to have a lecture to go with, but yet there are no lecture videos accessible on the class site.

Do not take her if have the choice, switch out now- especially if youre online. The textbook you are using is so complex and difficult to read. She did hold a online lecture every week but they didnt help much. She was disorganized. Youre basically teaching yourself this class. I feel like I lost out on learning valuable information.

This class felt extremely disorganized. Always responded to emails in under 24 hours. She did consistently hold online lectures to cover the material(which is more than other professors do), unfortunately I struggled understanding her accent and found my time was better spent reading the textbook.

The class has nothing to do, with the quizzes or test. She does put in effort but it is not enough. The questions are from a 2000 question bank in the textbook. She even looks at the questions and is sometimes confused. A GPA bomb of a class. The class did so terrible, she offered to let students turn in confusing questions for points back. Made 50
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Doesn't have the best English so instructions aren't always clear and will tell you it's your fault if you don't understand.
Her tests are so stupid. I don't know why we need to take those tests.

just like the CS department the IT department is awful. tests have so many errors, quizzes have errors, homework assignments have errors. if you took CSE 1321 you know how this is. however the professor is not to blame for it. its the departments fault. she shares code and explains things well. the tests are online and the answers are online as wel
She knows Java and she cares for her students to learn the concepts. Explains clearly on the board.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: STAY AWAY! She's about 15 minutes late every class and you'll have to resort to googling for any concepts she attempts to teach. Additionally, the tests are broken and ask you questions about things she never went over. "Do you follow?" No, I do not.

I was warned by my peers not to take her class, but I did because it she was the only one teaching this course during the summer. I'm so glad I took her class. She actually walked us through all the assignments and provided us with examples for the first three assignments. I'm so happy I took her course.

Absolutely Horrible This Professor uses Github to compare your assignments. If your assignments have one line that she thinks looks the same she will accuse you of cheating. She doesn't care about the fact that the book defines the code structure the same.

She knows her stuff, but her teaching style is sub par. Mostly just reads off the PowerPoint. Wish she would write on the board more too, as it's quite hard to follow her train of thought at times (plus a thick accent doesn't help). You will have to teach yourself most things if you want to pass with an A. She's a fair grader overall.
She is a fair grader. Always answered my questions in great detail. I took this class online and got an A. All of this classwork answers can be found in the book or in the powerpoint slides.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Would take again

comment: She recycled the power points and tests from the previous prof (i happen to be taking that prof in the same semester and recognized the work). Her "lectures" were honestly just her rambling and reading the slides and barely able to answer any questions about the topics. An iffy grader at best.
She is not a real professor, out of the 35 students in the course, only 7 -10 people show up for the class. She only reads the slides and reads them very fast.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY
